subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Text Conversion
msgSnippet: Hi Chuck don t worry about getting British dialect out of a book: I m British using two British accents and with a background in sociolinguistics, phonetics
messageBody:
Hi Chuck
don't worry about getting British dialect out of a book: I'm British using
two British accents and with a background in sociolinguistics, phonetics
etc; I'd be happy to proofread stuff and 'Britishise' it.
Cheers,
Andii

----- Original Message -----
From: "chuck091956" <chuck091956@...>
To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, July 21, 2003 5:35 PM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Text Conversion


> I will be creating the documents from the dialect that I live and
> write in with is American English. Once I get a few done, I'm planning
> on doing some in a British English. I have a phonic pronunciation
> database from a British university but I've yet to have any time to
> work with it. I think over all if you read enough QS in any dialect
> you'll benefit from it.
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "C. Paige Gabhart" <pgabhart@c..
> .> wrote:
